alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 29 at 5:56AM AKST until January 31 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with blizzard conditions at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Wind chills to 60 below. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could cause whiteout conditions. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 60 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills to 60 below are occuring this morning but will moderate this afternoon. Snow moving north over the area this morning along with increasing east winds will cause blowing snow with low visibility to develop this morning and continue into tonight. The strongest winds and lowest visibility in blowing snow are expected from late this morning into tonight. Snow will continue into Tuesday night. Winds turning west and increasing on Tuesday night could cause a return of blizzard conditions Tue night into Wed morning.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
